temples.name: santo-domingo-dominican-republic-temple
temples.history: The Santo Domingo Dominican Republic Temple was the first temple built in the Caribbean and in the Dominican Republic. The temple was announced on November 16, 1993, the groundbreaking and site dedication was on August 18, 1996, by Richard G. Scott, the public open house was from August 26 to September 9, 2000, and the dedication was on September 17, 2000, by Gordon B. Hinckley.
ordinanceschedule: Tuesday to Friday: 9:00 am, 10:00 am, 5:00 pm, 6:00 pm, and 7:00 pm, Walk-ins and Appointments.
Saturdays: 6:15 am, and Every hour from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm, Walk-ins and Appointments.

Saturdays: 6:15 am, and Every hour from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm, Walk-ins and Appointments.

temples.name: port-au-prince-haiti-temple
temples.history: The Port-au-Prince Haiti Temple is the first temple built in Haiti and the second built in the Caribbean, following the Santo Domingo Dominican Republic Temple (2000). The temple was announced on April 5, 2015, the groundbreaking and site dedication was on October 28, 2017, by Walter F. González, the public open house was from August 8 to August 17, 2019, and the dedication was on September 1, 2019, by David A. Bednar.
ordinanceschedule: Tuesday to Friday: 10:00 am, and 2:00 pm, Appointments Only.
Saturdays: 9:30 am, and 1:30 pm, Appointments Only.
sessionschedule: Tuesday to Friday: 10:00 am, and 2:00 pm, Appointments Only.
Saturdays: 9:30 am, and 1:30 pm, Appointments Only.

temples.name: orlando-florida-temple
temples.history: The Orlando Florida Temple was the first temple built in Florida. The Orlando Florida Temple is one of only two temples dedicated by President Howard W. Hunter during his brief time as president of the Church. (The other is the Bountiful Utah Temple.). In its official announcement of the Orlando Florida Temple as Florida's first temple, the First Presidency stated, <<We have selected Orlando because it is a central location with good highways from all parts of the state.>>. The temple was announced on February 17, 1990, the groundbreaking and site dedication was on  June 10, 1992, by James E. Faust, the public open house was from September 10 to 30, 1994, and the dedication was from Octubre 9 to 11, 1994, by Howard W. Hunter.

temples.name: fort-lauderdale-florida-temple
temples.history: The Fort Lauderdale Florida Temple was the second temple built in Florida, following the Orlando Florida Temple (1994). The Fort Lauderdale Florida Temple was named the ENR Southeast's <<Best Projects>> award winner for 2014 in the Cultural/Worship category. The temple was announced on October 3, 2009, the groundbreaking and site dedication was on June 18, 2011, by Walter F. González, the public open house was from March 29 to April 19, 2014, and the dedication was on 4, 2014, by Dieter F. Uchtdorf.
